reasoning: Sicca syndrome, also known as Sjögren's syndrome, has documented incidence of 4.2 cases per 100,000 person-years in US populations. Primary Sjögren's syndrome has prevalence of 1-9 per 10,000 (estimated 50-90 per 100,000 population). Incidence metric used for disease burden modeling, based on American-European classification criteria.
source: Poon KS et al. epidemiology of Sjögren syndrome in the general population; Nature Reviews Rheumatology 2023 (citing earlier US incidence data)
